intro: Aliciella lottiae, commonly known as the Lottia alga, is a marine alga belonging to the family Rhodomelaceae. It is characterized by its erect, branching thallus that typically grows in shallow coastal waters. The plant has a reddish to purple coloration due to the presence of accessory pigments like phycobilins. It thrives in intertidal zones and is often found attached to rocks or other substrates. Aliciella lottiae plays a role in coastal ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various marine organisms.
